description: The ID for the Total Financial Assistance Data Load

When true, this import will not create new financial aid packages that are identical to the existing active package for each student, institutional academic unit, and academic period submitted in the request.

Academic_UnitObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Academic_UnitObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Academic_UnitObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Total_Financial_Assistance_Academic_Peri.description: The Institutional Academic Unit to determine the financial aid record for the student to which this financial assistance data belongs.

StudentObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Total_Financial_Assistance_Academic_Peri.description: The student receiving this financial assistance data.

Academic_PeriodObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Total_Financial_Assistance_Academic_Peri.description: The academic period for when this financial assistance data belongs.

Student_Award_ItemObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Total_Financial_Assistance_Student_Award.description: The student award item for this student award.
The sequence number for this student award.
The amount awarded for this student award.
The amount accepted for this student award.

Total_Financial_Assistance_Student_Award.description: The student loan application for this student award.
Allows users to import disbursement data from an external source through the Import Total Financial Assistance task. Should be "True" if a user is importing information. Should be "False" otherwise.
Stores a disbursable amount from an external source through the Import Total Financial Assistance task. Field should only be used if "Use Disbursable" field is "True."

Total_Financial_Assistance_Academic_Peri.description: Element container for a Student Award within the Academic Period

validation.validation: Use the loan application that matches this award item.
Select an award year that matches the one on the loan application.
Select a loan application that matches this student.
A loan application must be associated with this award before importing your data. Create a loan application to link with this award.
You can't enter a disbursable amount greater than the amount accepted.
Check the Use Disbursable check box if you want to use it and define a disbursable amount for the award.

description: Element container for the total financial assistance data for the given student, institutional academic unit, and academic period.

validation.validation: The academic period must be within the calendar of the student's primary program of study.
The student must have a financial aid period record for the institutional academic unit and academic period.
Student must have a financial aid record that has academic records in the institutional academic unit.
Student cannot have more than one Work-Study Award with a Source of Institutional per Academic Period.
Student cannot have more than one Work-Study Award with a Source of State per Academic Period.
Student cannot have more than one Work-Study Award with a Source of Federal per Academic Period.
Student cannot have more than two Work-Study awards of source Federal, Institutional, or State per academic period.
There's already an award with this award item, sequence number, and academic period. Specify a unique combination of award item, sequence number, and academic period for the award.

You can only import financial aid packages from award years before the previous award year if you created the financial aid package through the Import Total Financial Assistance web service. Otherwise, you can only import financial aid packages from the current award year, previous award year, or future award years.
